bcl:definition.bcl:text: advisory committee means the committee under section 10;
annual report means a report under section 8;
strategy means the strategy under section 2.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must develop a strategy to reduce and prevent poverty in British Columbia.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: post the strategy in accordance with section 9 (a) by March 31, 2019, and
review and update the strategy at least once every 5 years after that date.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The strategy must include initiatives intended, over the 5-year period beginning on January 1, 2019, to reduce the poverty rate for 2024 below the poverty rate for 2016 by at least

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: 25% among all persons, and
50% among persons under 18 years of age.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The strategy must include initiatives intended to reduce and prevent poverty by increasing the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the affordability of goods, services and housing to persons living in poverty and other low-income British Columbians;
the opportunities for persons living in poverty to move out of poverty;
the inclusion of persons living in poverty in community life and in systems of supports.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the poverty rate must be measured using the market basket measure published by Statistics Canada as the "Market Basket Measure" or "Canada's Official Poverty Line".

The minister must review the targets set in subsection (1) before December 31, 2023 and, after doing so, may lay a report before the Legislative Assembly respecting future targets for the reduction of poverty.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The strategy must reflect a commitment to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reconciliation with Indigenous peoples,
the Calls to Action of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission, and
the United Nations Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In developing and updating the strategy, the minister must consider

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the breadth and depth of poverty, and
the full range of persons living in poverty.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the minister must consider the following topics:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: housing;
families, children and youth;
education;
employment;
income supports;
social supports.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the minister must consider the following groups:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: children;
youth;
women and persons of all genders;
Indigenous peoples;
persons living with disabilities;
persons living in rural and remote communities;
immigrants and refugees;
LGBTQ2S+ persons;
seniors;
persons and families working and earning low incomes;
persons living with or fleeing abuse;
persons living with mental illness or addiction;
persons of colour.

bcl:section.bcl:text: In developing and updating the strategy, the minister must consider the accessibility and coordination of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: initiatives included in the strategy, and
supports provided to or for persons living in poverty by or on behalf of the following:

bcl:section.bcl:text: The strategy must include a description of the effects that the minister intends poverty reduction and prevention to have on British Columbians as a whole.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must prepare, by October 1 of each calendar year, beginning in 2020, a report on the previous calendar year that describes the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the actions taken to implement the strategy;
the effects of the strategy on poverty reduction;
any progress made towards the targets set in section 3 (1).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An annual report on a calendar year must include the comments provided under section 10 (4) (a) in relation to that calendar year.
The minister must lay each annual report before the Legislative Assembly as soon as practicable and, promptly after doing so, must post the annual report in accordance with section 9 (a).

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: post the strategy and the annual reports on a publicly accessible website maintained by or on behalf of the minister, and
make the strategy and the annual reports available in accessible formats.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister must establish a committee to advise the minister on matters relating to poverty reduction and prevention.
At least half of the members of the advisory committee must be women.
The advisory committee must include a representative from at least each of the following groups:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Indigenous peoples;
persons living in poverty;
persons living with disabilities;
local governments;
organizations that advocate for persons living in poverty;
the business community;
unions;
academics;
persons living in rural and remote communities.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Without limiting subsection (1), the advisory committee has the following duties:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to give the minister comments in relation to a calendar year on the matters referred to in section 8 (1);
to advise the minister in relation to consultations under section 11.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Members of the advisory committee must be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: reimbursed for reasonable travelling and out-of-pocket expenses necessarily incurred by them in discharging their duties under this Act, and
if they are living in poverty, paid an honorarium.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In developing and updating the strategy, the minister must consult with representatives of at least the groups referred to in section 10 (3).
Consultations under subsection (1) must be carried out in a manner that is intended to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: ensure the strategy is informed by the experiences of persons living in poverty, and
uphold the commitment under section 4 to Indigenous peoples.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may provide monetary or other supports to or for persons living in poverty to enable them to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: serve on the advisory committee, or
participate in consultations under section 11 (1).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Section 5 of Offence Act does not apply
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 5 of the Offence Act does not apply to this Act or the regulations.
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in section 41 of the Interpretation Act.
This Act comes into force on the date of Royal Assent.
